text:
discovered that a JSP page using a package that links to a JDBC-ODBC bridge 
crashed if and only if (iff) it was set to be an NT service.  it seemed as if 
it was trying to run the bridge before the ODBC service had been initialized.  
perhaps this would be more stable if done at JSP run-time as opposed to 
catalina runtime.  don't know if that would work however with the JDBC-ODBC 
bridge being run in the package.

creator: funkman@joedog.org
text:
The JDBC-ODBC bridge is not thread safe and not meant for server applications.
Any  use of it will cause crashes (eventually)

Was just a simple JSP banking site for my roomates to view up-to-date 
spreadsheets of finances.  Figured it out though.  After a Windows Rebuild, 
which could have solved it.  I discovered that I may have set the ODBC under 
User instead of under System.  everything works now.

thanks for the response

Michael
